segments.text: Do you mind if I ask you a question ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , not at all . Go ahead .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What do you do in order to improve your English ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I go to movies ; I go to lectures ; I listen to the radio ; I do lots of things . Most importantly , I practice every chance I get .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s a good idea to have a radio , isn ’ t it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . It ’ s like understanding on the telephone — — you can ’ t see the speaker ! It ’ s great for improving listening comprehension .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It takes a long time to learn a language , doesn ’ t it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It certainly does . But if you practice speaking every spare minute and learn useful sentences every day you can make big progress .
segments.speaker: S2
